verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The Maker of the universe As Man, for man was made a curse. The claims of law which He had made, Unto the uttermost He paid.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}His holy fingers made the bough Which grew the thorns that crowned His brow. The nails that pierced His hands were mined In secret places He designed.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}He made the forest whence there sprung The tree on which His body hung. He died upon a cross of wood, Yet made the hill on which it stood.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The sky that darkened oâ€™er His head By Him above the earth was spread. The sun that hid from Him its face By His decree was poised in space.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The spear which spilled His precious blood Was tempered in the fires of God. The grave in which His form was laid, Was hewn in rocks His hands had made.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The throne on which He now appears Was His from everlasting years. But a new glory crowns His brow. And every knee to Him shall bow.{/lang-eng}
